TITLE.P: Dilution Refrigerator for Project Quantum Operations on a 1024-Qubit Processor

SHORT_DESCR.P: The subject of the contract is the purchase of a dilution refrigerator with the purpose of performing experiments for the quantum operations on a 1024-qubit procesor project. The setup shall be installed at section QuTech of TU Delft.
The guaranteed base temperature on the mixing chamber shall be lower than 10 mK.
The cooling power at 20 mK on the mixing chamber shall be higher than 17 μW.
The cooling power at 100 mK on the mixing chamber shall be higher than 500 μW.

The subject of the contract is the purchase of a dilution refrigerator with the purpose of performing experiments for the quantum operations on a 1024-qubit procesor project. The setup shall be installed at section QuTech of TU Delft.
The guaranteed base temperature on the mixing chamber shall be lower than 10 mK.
The cooling power at 20 mK on the mixing chamber shall be higher than 17 μW.
The cooling power at 100 mK on the mixing chamber shall be higher than 500 μW.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The 5-year project quantum operations on a 1024-qubit processor with lead-PI Menno Veldhorst is carried out together with Bluefors. Bluefors co-funds the project and is actively involved in the development to successfully carry out this project. The goal of this project is to execute quantum logic on a large array (1024) of silicon spin qubits. Base temperatures below 10 mK are required for the operation of the spin qubits and a dilution refrigerator will be purchased to enable operation at these temperatures. The budget for the dilution refrigerator is 410 000 EUR, including all wiring and helium. In this project we will develop together with Bluefors electrical components that operate in the dilution refrigerator. To make compatible electronics and potential changes to the dilution refrigerator, it is therefore essential that Bluefors has direct access to all necessary information of the dilution refrigerator. Information includes specifications, technology, drawings, size and used materials. Large cooling power below 10 mK and at 100 mK is essential to operate the qubits and the electronics. Furthermore, long-term operation is essential, since tuning and characterization is extensive. This means that it is crucial to continuously operate at base temperature for longer than 2 years. Moreover, these systems are sensitive to external vibrations, for example to the kHz frequency noise coming from the pulse tube (e.g. this type of known to be capable to significantly reduce quantum coherence [Kalra et al. Rev. Sci Instr. 2016]). It is therefore crucial to be able to operate without the presence of this type of noise. Finally, this refrigerator must be compatible with practical limitations imposed by the lab and size of the involved team.
In addition to the budget limitation and other requirements mentioned above, we therefore require the following technical specifications:
— the guaranteed base temperature on the mixing chamber shall be lower than 10 mK,
— the cooling power at 20 mK on the mixing chamber shall be higher than 17 μW,
— the cooling power at 100 mK on the mixing chamber shall be higher than 500 μW,
— longer than 2 hours of operation at base temperature without any pulse tube vibrations,
— proofed continuous operation at base temperature without liquid cryogenics for more than 2 years,
— maintenance free operation for longer than 2 years,
— the system shall not require more than 18l of 3He,
— the system should be operable fully by a single person, including during sample loading,
— the system footprint must fit within the designated lab space (approximately L x W x H: 3 m x 1,5 m x 3,2 m, with a 80 cm diameter ceiling hole for IO),
— power draw and cooling water requirements must be lower than the limit set by the facility,

— an exhaustive and conclusive test of all the specified requirements will be performed upon installation of the equipment at the end users laboratory at the TU Delft. Full payment will be conditioned on fulfilling the specified hardware and software requirements,
— 5 year warranty on the dilution unit against any leakage.
